problem.question: How can you cool down a hot cup of coffee quickly?
options: Pour the coffee into a wide, shallow bowl to increase surface area for heat dissipation.
Keep the coffee in the narrow mug and blow on it occasionally.

key_steps: Heat dissipation rate proportional to surface area
Wide shallow bowl maximizes surface area exposed to air
Increased surface area accelerates convective cooling
Narrow mug minimizes surface area, slowing cooling

constraints.description: Heat transfer rate depends on surface area
Surface area increases with width, decreases with depth

logic_requirements: Explains relationship between surface area and cooling rate
Correctly identifies wider vessel as having more surface area
